alert.note: Alert for Ashland; Iron (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 18 at 4:31PM CST until February 18 at 4:45PM CST by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM CST FOR CENTRAL IRON AND SOUTHERN ASHLAND COUNTIES... At 430 PM CST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from Wakefield, to 6 miles southeast of Gile, to 7 miles southeast of Upson, to 7 miles northwest of Glidden, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Extremely poor visibility in heavy snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts greater than 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. This includes Wisconsin Highway 13 from Mellen to Butternut. Locations impacted include... Turtle Flambeau Flowage, Mercer, Butternut, Glidden, Clam Lake, Morse, Long Lake, Van Buskirk, Gile Flowage, Manitowish, Island Lake Iron County, and Day Lake. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead to accidents. Reduce your speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions.
